items.title: Airway Flow Modeling
items.description: Advanced computational fluid dynamics modeling of respiratory airways from nasal cavities to lung bronchioles. We create detailed 3D models to understand airflow patterns, pressure distributions, and breathing mechanics for medical research and clinical applications.

items.title: Inhaled Drug Delivery Deposition Quantification
items.description: Precise quantification and optimization of drug particle deposition in respiratory systems. Our advanced modeling techniques predict where and how much medication deposits in specific lung regions, enabling better therapeutic outcomes and drug formulation design.

items.title: Inhaler Device Optimization
items.description: Comprehensive analysis and optimization of inhaler devices including MDIs, DPIs, and nebulizers. We evaluate device performance, particle generation, flow dynamics, and delivery efficiency to help pharmaceutical companies develop more effective inhalation devices.

items.title: 3D Flow Rendering & Visualization
items.description: High-quality 3D visualizations and animations of respiratory airflow, particle trajectories, and drug deposition patterns. Our advanced rendering techniques create compelling visual representations for research presentations, regulatory submissions, and educational purposes.

about.title: Respiratory Engineering Lab
paragraphs: With over a decade of experience in computational fluid dynamics, our team specializes in the complex world of respiratory airflow modeling. We combine advanced simulation techniques with deep understanding of physiological and engineering principles.

Our expertise spans from microscale particle transport in lung airways to large-scale biomedical flow analysis. We work with medical device manufacturers, pharmaceutical companies, research institutions, and engineering firms worldwide.

research.title: Research Publications
research.subtitle: Scientific contributions and peer-reviewed research by Dr. Alister Bates

papers.title: Human upper-airway respiratory airflow: In vivo comparison of computational fluid dynamics simulations and hyperpolarized 129Xe phase contrast MRI velocimetry
papers.authors: Qiwei Xiao, Neil J. Stewart, Matthew M. Willmering, Chamindu C. Gunatilaka, Robert P. Thomen, Andreas Schuh, Guruprasad Krishnamoorthy, Hui Wang, Raouf S. Amin, Charles L. Dumoulin, Jason C. Woods, Alister J. Bates
papers.abstract: Computational fluid dynamics (CFD) simulations of respiratory airflow have the potential to change the clinical assessment of regional airway function in health and disease. This study compared CFD simulations with phase contrast MRI using hyperpolarized 129Xe gas in three healthy subjects, showing good qualitative agreement in flow patterns and statistically significant correlations between velocity values.

papers.title: The Effect of Airway Motion and Breathing Phase During Imaging on CFD Simulations of Respiratory Airflow
papers.authors: Alister J. Bates, Andreas Schuh, Guruprasad Krishnamoorthy, Robert P. Thomen, Jason C. Woods
papers.abstract: This study quantifies how much the airway moves during the respiratory cycle and determines how this motion affects CFD pressure loss predictions. The research demonstrates that realistic movement of the airway is vital to producing clinically relevant computational models of respiratory airflow.

papers.title: A novel method to generate dynamic boundary conditions for airway CFD by mapping upper airway movement with non-rigid registration of dynamic and static MRI
papers.authors: Alister J. Bates, Andreas Schuh, Guruprasad Krishnamoorthy, Robert P. Thomen, Charles L. Dumoulin, Jason C. Woods
papers.journal: International Journal for Numerical Methods in Biomedical Engineering
papers.abstract: A novel method for generating dynamic boundary conditions for CFD simulations by mapping upper airway movement using non-rigid registration of dynamic and static MRI. This approach enables the incorporation of realistic airway motion into CFD models.

papers.title: Assessing the relationship between movement and airflow in the upper airway using computational fluid dynamics with motion determined from magnetic resonance imaging
papers.authors: Alister J. Bates, Andreas Schuh, Guruprasad Krishnamoorthy, Robert P. Thomen, Charles L. Dumoulin, Jason C. Woods
papers.abstract: This study assesses the relationship between airway wall movement and airflow using computational fluid dynamics with motion determined from magnetic resonance imaging. The work demonstrates the importance of including dynamic wall motion in respiratory CFD simulations.

papers.title: Effects of respiratory rate on the fluid mechanics of a reconstructed upper airway
papers.authors: Alister J. Bates, Raouf S. Amin, Ephraim J. Gutmark
papers.abstract: Investigation of how respiratory rate affects the fluid mechanics of the upper airway using CFD simulations on reconstructed geometries. This study provides insights into the effects of breathing patterns on airway flow characteristics.

papers.title: The effect of including dynamic imaging derived airway wall motion in CFD simulations of respiratory airflow in patients with OSA
papers.authors: Alister J. Bates, Jason C. Woods, Raouf S. Amin
papers.abstract: This study examines how including dynamic airway wall motion affects CFD predictions in patients with obstructive sleep apnea (OSA). The research shows that airway motion significantly impacts pressure loss calculations and clinical assessment of airway resistance.
